images.caption: Figure 1:ARC’s adversarial relativistic loss. Pairs of generated and real samples (with the same text prompts) are passed into the discriminator (with additive noise), where the generator and discriminator are trained to minimize and maximize (respectively) the difference between fake and real outputs.
Figure 2:ARC’s contrastive loss. The discriminator is also trained to maximize the difference between audios with correct and incorrect (shuffled) prompts.
